text:genesis-logos.title: The Logos in Genesis and John
text:genesis-logos.summary: The term Logos appears in John 1:1. Also in Greek philosophy as the rational principle of the cosmos.

trad:kabbalah-ein-sof.title: Ein Sof in Kabbalah
trad:kabbalah-ein-sof.summary: The Infinite prior to manifestation appears in Kabbalah as Ein Sof and in Vedanta as Nirguna Brahman.

trad:kabbalah-tzimtzum.title: Tzimtzum: Divine Contraction
trad:kabbalah-tzimtzum.summary: In Lurianic Kabbalah, Tzimtzum is the contraction of the Infinite to create space for the finite.

phys:photon.title: The Photon as Foundation
phys:photon.summary: Modern physics confirms that the photon is fundamental to all matter. All matter can be understood as condensed light.

astro:spiral-galaxies.title: Spiral Galaxies
astro:spiral-galaxies.summary: Most galaxies have spiral structure. The Milky Way is a barred spiral galaxy.

phys:spiral-nature.title: Spirals in Nature
phys:spiral-nature.summary: The spiral pattern appears at all scales: galaxies, hurricanes, DNA, nautilus shells.

phys:holographic-principle.title: The Holographic Principle
phys:holographic-principle.summary: The holographic principle suggests all information in a volume can be encoded on its surface.

phys:electromagnetic-spectrum.title: Electromagnetic Radiation
phys:electromagnetic-spectrum.summary: The spectrum includes radio waves through gamma rays. All are photons differentiated by frequency.

astro:lenticular-shape.title: Lenticular Shape
astro:lenticular-shape.summary: The flattened disk shape common to solar systems and spiral galaxies seen edge-on.

phys:musical-octave.title: The Musical Octave
phys:musical-octave.summary: An octave is the interval between a note and another with double its frequency.

trad:gurdjieff-octave.title: Gurdjieff Law of Octaves
trad:gurdjieff-octave.summary: Gurdjieff taught that all processes follow the Law of Seven with intervals between Mi-Fa and Si-Do.

phys:color-spectrum.title: The Color Spectrum
phys:color-spectrum.summary: The visible spectrum has seven colors corresponding to the seven densities.

trad:chakra-system.title: The Chakra System
trad:chakra-system.summary: The yogic system identifies seven energy centers with matching colors.

trad:four-elements.title: The Four Classical Elements
trad:four-elements.summary: Fire, air, water, earth appear in Greek philosophy and many traditions.

math:fractals.title: Fractals
math:fractals.summary: Fractal geometry shows many natural forms exhibit self-similarity at all scales.

trad:indras-net.title: Indra Net
trad:indras-net.summary: An infinite web with a jewel at each node, where each jewel reflects all others.

phys:bohm-implicate-order.title: Bohm Implicate Order
phys:bohm-implicate-order.summary: David Bohm proposed that the whole is folded within each part of the universe.

phys:atomic-void.title: Atomic Void
phys:atomic-void.summary: An atom is mostly empty space. Solidity is an electromagnetic illusion.

trad:vedanta-maya.title: Maya in Vedanta
trad:vedanta-maya.summary: Maya is the illusion of the phenomenal world that conceals ultimate reality.

phys:quantum-mechanics.title: Quantum Mechanics
phys:quantum-mechanics.summary: Particles are probability waves that collapse only when observed.

sci:hoffman-consciousness.title: Donald Hoffman on Consciousness
sci:hoffman-consciousness.summary: Cognitive scientist Donald Hoffman argues that consciousness is fundamental and that spacetime is a user interface, not ultimate reality.

phil:plato-cave.title: Plato's Allegory of the Cave
phil:plato-cave.summary: In Plato's Republic, prisoners in a cave mistake shadows for reality, symbolizing how we confuse appearances for truth until we achieve philosophical enlightenment.

phil:technology-ethics.title: Technology Ethics
phil:technology-ethics.summary: The philosophical examination of how technological power should be guided by wisdom and ethical consideration, not merely capability.

astro:asteroid-belt.title: The Asteroid Belt
astro:asteroid-belt.summary: A region between Mars and Jupiter containing millions of rocky objects. Some theories suggest it could be remnants of a planet that never formed or was destroyed.

hist:giza-pyramids.title: The Pyramids of Giza
hist:giza-pyramids.summary: Ancient Egyptian monuments built approximately 4,500 years ago. The Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure for over 3,800 years.

trad:hinduism-karma.title: Karma
trad:hinduism-karma.summary: The principle of cause and effect where actions influence future experiences. Present in Hinduism, Buddhism, and Jainism as a fundamental law of spiritual balance.

psych:jung-collective-unconscious.title: The Collective Unconscious
psych:jung-collective-unconscious.summary: Carl Jung's concept: a layer of the psyche shared by all humanity, containing archetypes and ancestral memories common to everyone.

trad:eschatology-comparative.title: Comparative Eschatology
trad:eschatology-comparative.summary: The study of beliefs about the end times and world transformation across traditions: Christian Apocalypse, Hindu Kali Yuga, Buddhist Maitreya.

psych:jung-unconscious.title: The Unconscious in Jung
psych:jung-unconscious.summary: For Carl Jung, the unconscious contains not only repressed material but also creative potentials, ancestral wisdom, and connection to the transcendent.

trad:chakra-kundalini.title: Kundalini and the Chakras
trad:chakra-kundalini.summary: In yogic traditions, kundalini is dormant energy at the spine's base that, when awakened, rises through each energy center to reach the crown.

trad:buddhism-dukkha.title: Dukkha: Suffering
trad:buddhism-dukkha.summary: First Noble Truth of Buddhism: existence involves inherent unsatisfactoriness. Not pessimism but recognition that attachment causes suffering, and liberation is possible.

psych:jung-synchronicity.title: Synchronicity
psych:jung-synchronicity.summary: Carl Jung's concept: meaningful coincidences without causal connection yet linked by significance. Suggests a deep connection between mind and matter.

bio:meditation-brain.title: Meditation and the Brain
bio:meditation-brain.summary: Neuroscience studies show regular meditation produces measurable changes: increases gray matter, reduces amygdala activity, strengthens prefrontal cortex.

trad:contemplative-prayer.title: Contemplative Prayer
trad:contemplative-prayer.summary: Practice found in Christian mysticism, Sufism, and Hinduism: silencing the mind to directly experience divine presence, beyond words and images.

trad:hermetic-principles.title: Hermetic Principles
trad:hermetic-principles.summary: Seven universal laws from the Kybalion: Mentalism, Correspondence, Vibration, Polarity, Rhythm, Cause and Effect, Gender. Summary of ancient wisdom attributed to Hermes Trismegistus.
